headline.main: WHEN BUYING HEALTH CARE IS LIKE BUYING BREAD

byline.original: By S. RICK LIFTIG; S. Rick Liftig is a dentist in West Hartford

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: YOU may remember Jack Riley. He played the paranoid hypochondriac Eliot Carlin on the old ''Bob Newhart Show.'' When the ConnectiCare Health Plan needed a new spokesman, what better example of a medically afflicted layman would there be than Mr. Carlin?

headline.main: WE LIVE IN A SOCIETY OF EXCESS - WHY?

byline.original: By BERNARD MACKLER; Bernard Mackler lives in Scarsdale

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: OUR society is laden with excess. We have abundant wealth and too much poverty, excessive military and nuclear arms and on and on. I see the excess in our society in its emphasis on success, achievement, thinness, grades, athletic prowess, sexual extravagance, alcohol and drugs - on exaggeration.
